bibl.title: The Heiress Calpurnia Heraclia.
Proceedings of the 20th International Congress of Papyrologists
bibl.author: BASSIOUNI, Soheir Zaki

bibl.note: Calpurnia Heraclia in the third century had a property of land not less than 2200 arourae, most of which was acquired by inheritance through her family for more than 250 years. This is, so far, the longest recorded history of a property in the same family in Roman Egypt.
BASSIOUNI Soheir Zaki, The Heiress Calpurnia Heraclia.
Proceedings of the 20th International Congress of Papyrologists (Copenhagen, 1994) pp. 522-524, 1 tabl.
